text:
ü™≤An Eco Pond at the Windsor Nature Park entrance.
üêüFun fact:
Eco Pond are body of water that are kept clean and healthy through natural filtration that would include plants, rocks & gravels for filtration, pond fish and waterfalls & streams to aerate the water converting harmful ammonia to harmless nitrates. ü¶Äü¶ê

A marvellous spot to enter MacRitchie Reservoir because there is a long flat clean pathway that cuts across the long forest. Even on rainy days you can stand on the stony paths or get thru. But avoid wearing sport shoes cos they will break later on if they touched too much mud. Advised to use proper hiking shoes such as timberland or north face.

I love this pond. I have been taking photos of the dragonflies here for many months. They were intriguing and taught me about the world of nature and how we should appreciate them and not disturb their eco system.
I love the turtles, the fish, and the pondskaters.
This tree is infront of the Toilet at the entrance of Windsor Nature Park. Full of flower.
